About

Born and raised in Chicago, I actually enjoyed the weather.

I played varsity soccer at Northwestern and studied Computer Science in the McCormick School of Engineering.

At Northwestern, I worked on BarLift, did research at Delta Lab and DTR, had a paper published, and was even named Big Ten Defensive Player of the Week.

During my senior year I worked part time getting FlyHomes off the ground. As I finished my degree, I was able to transition to full-time and build out a 5 person engineering team based out of India. We sold around 50 homes sold across 3 cities, and built the team to about 20 before I left. Hereâ€™s a somewhat recent article about the early days.

In February 2017, I decided to move to San Francisco and join Hearth. Since then weâ€™ve grown the company to over 180 people with an engineering team size of over 24.
